title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: Upon creating a new project for an existing directory structure, there is no confirmation that the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt. Some users create projects and set the output folder to a bin directory, which may contain more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: When creating a new project, we should have a confirmation step ensuring that the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt successfully. This is crucial, especially for users who set the output folder to a bin directory containing files beyond .class files that can be regenerated from the available .java files.
SR:
1. Open the application and navigate to the project creation section.
2. Choose an existing directory structure.
3. Set the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files.
4. Follow the project creation process.
5. Observe the lack of confirmation regarding the ability to delete and rebuild the output directory.
